headline: Pico de Gallo
description: Pico de gallo is easy to make with fresh tomatoes, red onion, jalape√±o, coriander, lime juice, and seasonings for a flavor-packed Mexican salsa.

video.description: Fresh tomatoes, peppers, and onions come together for a fresh and delicious pico de gallo!
video.name: How to Make Pico de Gallo

name: Pico de Gallo
recipeIngredient: 1 pinch ground cumin, or to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Stir tomatoes, onion, cilantro, jalape√±o pepper, lime juice, garlic, garlic powder, cumin, salt, and pepper together in a bowl.

review.reviewBody: This was great!!! My entire family loved it even my 6 yr old
easy and tasty! will make this again.

Love this so much! This is 1000 times better than store bought. I usually use a lot more cilantro (a good handful) and sometimes I use grape tomatoes, but they're a pain to chop up. We devour this stuff and sometimes mix it with mashed avocado to make guacamole. So so so good!
I like it
Quick and easy that is delicious
Great and Simple Recipe!

First time making my own Pico de Gallo. I followed the recipe, next time I will omit the cumin. Otherwise the recipe is good. I also added extra garlic clove and cilantro. It really is about one's personal taste. I'll be saving this recipe. I love the fact that by making my own, I know the freshness of the ingredients and whose hands have been in my Pico de Gallo!!
Only "change" was adding more jalape√±os, love the spiciness with extra peppers üòÅ
My husband loves his Pico De Gallo and he loved this recipe! Only thing I did was add just one extra clove garlic and one extra tablespoons lime juice Thanks for a great recipe!
LOVE LOVE LOVE IT! I may have over processed in the blender a bit but the flavor is OUTSTANDING.
Love This!!
Very refreshing! It added a great flavor on fish tacos!

This was great sticking to the recipe other then using more fresh garlic instead or powdered. Later on adding 1 tbsp of vinegar and 1tbsp of vegetable oil along with more jalape√±o made this outstanding. Used this on carnita tacos, a really big hit with the wife.
The recipe was pretty simple and it really didn‚Äôt take long wife who eats this just about everyday says it was amazing I‚Äôll update it after 3 hrs

I made this for a taco bar party. I didn't add a pinch of cumin and mixed half cilantro with half parsley because we personally do not like the smell of cilantro. It turned out great and the taste was very authentic to what we have tried at our favorite Mexican restaurants. Thank you!
This is awesome! I changed out the jalape√±o for a Pablano
I didn't have any spicy peppers so substitued orange bell pepper. Tasted fresh and yummy.
Wouldn't change a thing. Remember to seed your tomatoes so the pico doesn't get too watery.
So yummy. Great for tostitos
awesome
This was really good. served on top Chicken chimichangas.

Delicious. I used one large ripe beefsteak tomato, yellow and white onion and two large jalepenos all from my back yard garden in Texas. I used dried cilantro and minced garlic from a jar plus lime juice from real lime bottle. Very good, and will be having it with chicken burrito for dinner, and tortilla chips for lunch.

Packs a Punch!
Great recipe. I usually cut it in half unless making for a party. So easy.
Yum!
Yummy! Gets better as it sits!
Perfect! Thanks!
Made it exactly as written. Delicious!
Very easy and very good!
I enjoyed the taste that brighten up my Mexican food!!!!!
Easy peasey and delicious. Subbed a spoonful of chili garlic sauce since I didn't have any spicy peppers. Yum!

This is the definitive pico de gallo recipe, as far as I am concerned. Every ingredient has a purpose and contributes to the outstanding flavor of the whole. I just made a batch with the last of the scrumptious tomatoes from our garden. It was gobbled up in less than 24 hours. Paired this recipe with those multigrain chips that Costco sells is a perfect match.
I love this recipe with a few minor changes. Didnt have any limes so used lemon juice (have lemon trees in my garden.) Also, I like spicey, doubled the amount of garlic and jalapeno. Excellent!
Delicious and fresh. Love the bit of cumin. Didn‚Äôt have red onion so I used white, didn‚Äôt have jalape√±os so I just used a bit of cayenne pepper. Not authentic, but delicious still!
Excellent. No changes needed. The longer you refrigerate it though, the better it is.
This is delicious. I had to use cilantro that comes in a tube. I am sure its even better with fresh!

Perfect. Never better. 
Thank you
Made no changes. We use on our eggs at breakfast and as a dip with chips.
It tasted great. I used a whole jalapeno tho. Other than that went by recipe.
Delicious
It wasn't bad, but I did have to add a little more salt and garlic than was called for to better align with my palette. Otherwise, it was fresh, easy to make, and once I made the adjustments, good.
Excellent! Perfect ingredients, yet I adjusted it to my family's taste - more cilantro and cumin less jalapenos because my husband is tender although I add more jalapenos to my servings
I made this today. This is an easy and delicious salsa. I used everything from our garden except the red onion. I added a tiny bit of fresh garlic. This salsa is really yummy!
Made it! Just a great combination of flavors!
I love this pico recipe. I add a little of some jar jalapenos and some juice. I also add a couple of squirts of Stevia.

This stuff is so good that it won over my tomato-hating 14-yr-old daughter! (It's now her favorite thing to make and eat.) We've made it about a half dozen times now and the only changes we've adopted are using white or yellow onion instead of red (simply because I always have those on hand), increasing the cumin to suit our taste, and adding a generous sprinkle of salt and fresh-ground pepper. This pico is beyond delicious!

I made this today and it is terrific! This will be a go-to at our house from now on. I doubled the onion and garlic based on other reviews and it was perfect for us...we tend to like a lot of both of those. I was worried about the jalape√±o, but it wasn‚Äôt spicy, just flavorful. Thank you for a great recipe!

Even though I could not add the jalape√±os and the red onion, and had to replace it with yellow onion, this was flavorful. I wish I could eat both items I had omitted, but well it is still very good! Will make it again!!
It was a great recipe! I used tomatoes right off the vine from my garden for a fresh taste. And I added a Cajun seasoning for added taste and spice!?
I made this and it turned out great! It was slightly spicy, equivalent to a medium salsa. Lemon would work as a substitute for the lime, and I added quite a bit of pepper. Totally recommend!
Wow! what a perfect blend! Let it sit for an hour or two to bring out the flavors. Definitely making again!
I made this for supper last week, and it didn't last until mealtime. My kids (and I) devoured it immediately.
This was fabulous! Eaten plain on a tortilla chip it has some kick, and for reference I can handle a lot of heat! But when I added it to my fajitas it was perfect!
Used two vine tomatoes instead of romas, a large slice of yellow onion instead of red, and a few tablespoons of canned green chiles instead of jalape√±o.
Amazing pico de gallo! I added a bit more jalapeno to make it spicier. Everyone loved it!
Amazing pico de gallo! I added a bit more jalapeno to make it spicier. Everyone loved it!
This is really good!! I did use green onion instead of the red, other than that, wonderful!!!

My 18 year old son made this for the first time. He works in a restaurant that has been shut down temporarily due to Covid-19, and he was missing eating pico de gallo at the restaurant. It was so delicious! We are going to put some yellow or orange bell peppers in it next time for more crunch. We also doubled the recipe, and it was gone within a day's time. Yum!
Family loves it!
I roasted and seeded my jalapenos. Best after sitting for 24 or more hours
Taste great!
My mom loved this recipe. I thought it was okay. In my opinion it needed more of just about everything.
Perfect Pico DeGallo. I added more cilantro and onion but the recipe is just what I get at the restaurant!
love this!
great recipe. No changes. love it!
This is very good over tostadas, on tacos, and in burritos. I will definitely be making this regularly.
Easy and delicious!!
It doesn‚Äôt get any better than this.
Good flavor. IMO too many tomatoes. I put 4 Roma tomatoes in it that were small/medium size. still too many though...
Very good. I used red and white onion came out great, I did use more garlic I chopped up 3 cloves of garlic.

I‚Äôve made a couple of different pico de gallo recipes and this is definitely my favorite. I think the touch of cumin adds a slightly different taste than the others. Even my 2 1/2 year old grandson asks for more!!
Sooooooo easy and a big hit on taco night. Plenty leftover for snacking the next day.
Substitute onion for jalepino
I make this for everything! Taco night is incomplete without. My son asks for this specifically.
Yes, I Will Make It Again, Yes, I Added Extra Garlic, Whole Jalapeno (Seeded)..Perfect

This is very tasty., but a bit too much onion for my liking. I used about 2 TBSP less than it called for. I suggest adding a bit at a time and ‚Äúeyeballing‚Äù what looks right. Probably depends on how big your tomatoes are.

This was so fresh and amazing in taste. I‚Äôve made it twice now. Second time was even better. I roasted an ear of corn on the grill and added that as well as a can of rinsed black beans. My husband can‚Äôt get enough of it.

This pico is perfect, don't change a thing! 

FYI, I hate the tomato core so I cut my tomatoes vertically around the core, then sliced them up from there. That made for a very consistent tomato character.

So I was iffy because I tried a bit after I first made it and it was not that great, but then I refrigerated it (like you are supposed to, I was just impatient) and it was wonderful. Honestly the best I‚Äôve had! I tweaked it a bit the second time (added more tomatoes), and it was just as good. Recipe is flexible and delish, just make sure to let it all soak together in the refrigerator before eating lol.
I'm not a doctor, but this is the way it should be done.
It was delicious. Just took a while , 30!min., to chop everything given my arthritic hands.
I used vine ripened tomatoes, a whole jalape√±o and the whole lime juiced. I also added an avocado right before serving. This is a great, summery salad. I would make it again.
So easy and yummy to make!! Love it!!
I made it in smaller portion but it was so good I‚Äôm making it again tomorrow to put on quinoa and black bean salad.

ive made this Pico twice now. one following the recipe. It was fantastic. the second time I added 3 Serrano peppers to the mix to spice it up. I added 2 extra tomatoes and 4 Tbsp lime juice. It was fantastic as well.
Excellent recipe. Very easy. A new addition to our family cookbook. Mixed leftovers in eggs for a tasty breakfast.
This was an excellent recipe. It was gone 15 minutes after I set it out. Next time, I will double...maybe triple...it. Thank you for posting such a delicious, healthy, easy recipe!

My family loves to eat authentic taquitos. This mean carne asada, pico de gallo and flour tortillas and this home made pico is to die for! I use both red and sweet white onion. I did added cilantro to my taste and my family loves it. I have to take it to all my church potluck dinner
I loved this recipe me and my brother were trying to find the best recipe and it ended up being this one it was very juicy and the ingredients easy to find
The BEST Pico EVER! No changes needed for this!!!

No changes! It‚Äôs an awesome pico de gallo. Very fresh!
Updated June 2019:
These days, jalepenos I find in my stores have less flavor than bell pepper. Use a pepper you like or add ground red (cayenne) to heat it up a bit.

Love it. I had a craving for Pico De Gallo and decided to try this recipe. This hits the spot. It's a very traditional authentic recipe and you can tweak it any way you please, Can't go wrong with it. Thank you!
I put in a full jalapeno instead of half. It didn't add as much kick as I would have liked, but it tasted fresh and everyone liked it.
I've made this a couple times. We're not big jalapeno fans but used them the first time around. Subsequent runs at it, used good old Louisiana Hot Sauce to taste. Also increased the cilantro.
I love the southwestern flavours, so I doubled the lime juice and cilantro!
Great tasting pico de gallo! We loved it. I chopped everything very fine, added a bit more lime and cilantro but otherwise it‚Äôs a great recipe.
hubby and i absolutely loved it. I added some green and red peppers also
It was so easy to make and so tasty! I added in the full limes juice.

I changed the servings to 4 and followed recipe with a couple of exceptions. I used yellow onion and left out the garlic powder. Kind of blah. Then I added just that small amount of garlic powder and it made a HUGE difference. I'm in Texas and know good pick when I taste it And this is great!
Try it in an omelet with a little ham or bacon and cheese. My morning staple.
I tend to view recipes as suggested guidelines - I used 1/2 an orange for and 1/2 a lime. Probably a bit more cilantro. Turned out perfect. One of the better Pico de Gallo attempts.

Awesome recipe, thanks for sharing. I didn't realize it was so easy to make pico de gallo, no dressing required! I love the freshness of all the ingredients, especially the crisp onions. The acidity of the tomatoes and lime sort of act as a preservative. I'll definitely be making this again!
